website_summaries.verdict: A lot of functions in a sturdy little tool that comes in a handy metal case.
pros: Enough tools to help you assemble an entire bike
Good-quality tools that are sturdy and reliable when you're using them
Small enough to fit in a saddle bag
cons: The tool is a little heavy
Tool is not stainless steel and can show rust if not kept dry

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.text: On the third use one of this it bent. Probably made in CHINA and very poor quality. This product is a shame for Crank Brothers Multi Bicycle Tool. Not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pirvelli

customer_reviews.title: Great Emergency Bike Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is overall an excellent bike repair tool that covers just about every eventually. It's a bit heavy, but also very compact, and fits easily into my saddle bag. I don't get the case it comes it -- it's almost impossible to open. Perhaps it's just for shipping and display, but I ditched it and went without.
customer_reviews.author: Lowpad

customer_reviews.title: Metal case edge is sharp. I've my fingers cut. Keys are loose.
customer_reviews.text: Metal case edge is too sharp. I've my fingers cut only few minutes after delivery of the shipment. Thanks God it's a superficial wound. But they should make edges more smooth. So please anyone take care. Also the material of keys is not good as described.
customer_reviews.author: Ayman Hamdi

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Needed it last night on a ride and it was easy to use and got me back on the road. Metal case feels really nice and slides into your pack smoothly. Tool itself is a tad heavier than others I've tried, but it has more tools than feels nice and sturdy. Overall I'm super pleased with it so far. I'll keep an eye on the two attachment bolts, as all the negative reviews seems to show those bolts loosening over time and coming apart. I'll update this if it fails on me or the torx bit breaks. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Not light, but very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Not light, but very useful. I have been using these for about a year now. I carry them on my mountain trike, but not on my road racing trike. I do not know how much this weighs, but they are heavier than I expected. Very useful tool though. We were riding from Telluride Co. to Moab Ut along the San Juan hut system, 132 miles 26000 vertical feet. This tool was able to handle any job we threw at it. From fixing a broken chain, tightening loose spokes, to truing a wheel. It was worth the extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Patch

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, bad chain breaker, terrible case, Park Tool IB-3 is better.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of sharp tools. Mine had unfinished edges. The chain breaker has no leverage and didn't work. It comes with a case that is made of metal but if you get your tool in that case it will be hard to remove. I switched to the Park Tool IB-3 and have never been happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jones

customer_reviews.title: One tool to rule them all
customer_reviews.text: This tool has everything you'll need for a trailside repair and then some. It even has an 8mm hex, which is a rarity for multitools. Note that many people get by with carrying much less. If you know your bike well, you can likely pick a smaller and lighter tool that still has what you need. If you're that person that wants to be as prepared as possible, though, this is the tool for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: So far.........Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The product is very well made. Does not seem to be a stamped out product but made of good quality metal and assembled very well. Each of the tools fit the object they are made for. The layout of the tools utilizes the space requirements for the case and utilizes the most the requirements for each tool as dictated by most bicycle manufactures. One added caveat is the multi function can be used for different application such as small work on telescopes due to the same size screws, bolts, hex head and straight slots. If major work is required on the bicycle then acquire the correct tools to work with. Good job Crankbrothers. Nice tool.
customer_reviews.author: SnoopGrampyGramps

customer_reviews.title: Terrible case; limit hand torque or it breaks
customer_reviews.text: The case is terrible. I can’t say enough how much I hate the case. Looks nice. PITA to open. Broke the tool the 4th occurrence of using it while trying to swap out a seat. Seat was probably overtightened by bike shop. Tool broke apart in my hand when I gave a little extra oomph. I’m not Superman strength so I’m rather disappointed. One of the 4 screws holding the tool together snapped apart. Now useless. This tool is only for light jobs and you are probably stronger than it is. I won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Decent multi-tool, but maybe not the most durable.
customer_reviews.text: I've kept this tool in my saddlebag, but have rarely used it. Took it out today and noticed that some of the tools have serious rust and pitting. I don't really ride in wet conditions, so not sure how it ended up like this. It's pretty heavy so I would only recommend taking it if you absolutely think you might need to do some roadside repair. Otherwise, I recommend buying a cheap 4mm and 5mm hex wrench, tape them together with some Gorilla tape and stuff that in your bag. If you need anything more than those two wrenches, you probably want a car ride anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeits galore
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased one off here and it blew up and turned out it was counterfeit you should be careful. Response from Crank Brothers on how to identify counterfeit
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Crank Bros product
customer_reviews.text: In the 4 times, I have used this since purchasing it has fallen apart 3 times, all on the trail when I needed it most. The end screws that hold it together are the weak link, they strip and give out. I tried using today to make sure my shifters were tight before riding and the screw flew off into the dirt. I am so thoroughly disappointed with this tool. There are much sturdier, reliable, and affordable multi-tools out there so make sure you shop around and don't just go by the brand name as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Maya

customer_reviews.title: Refund please
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Looks nice and has a boat load of tools and sizes. Carried it in my mtn biking backpack for months just for emergency use (at home I use nicer tools in the shop). On the second time I used it briefly to adjust my daughters seat, one of the set screws on the four corners flies out and entire thing essentially dissolved on the ground. We put most of it back together but without the screw (lost) it’s now a shiny paperweight. Please send me a set of screws or redesign it altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Feydakin

customer_reviews.title: Useless Case?
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this tool. It was slightly larger and heavier than I expected, but has everything I need, including the two torx drivers for SRAM Hydro disc brake calipers. I found the inclusion of a case to be odd. I don't think I will use it ever. Seems like a waste and is hard to open. Although the main body of the case is anodized aluminum, it still has a cheap feel with plastic plug ends and an unpleasant tactile quality - I think the opposite of what the desired effect was, to give the product a premium feel. Overall I like this tool. The case feels like landfill fodder.
customer_reviews.author: RFD

customer_reviews.title: Well made, very useful
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have everything, but it's got 99% of what you'll need to do quick repairs on a bike, and almost everything else around the house that needs tightening, batteries or bulbs replaced, or recharges. I guess if there was a chain breaker and a spork built in, it'd have everything. It's been my "go to" tool lately - mostly because I keep it on my bike, and I always know where that is. I can't say that for the rest of my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: This multi tool has just about everything you need to work on a bike (besides tire levers). It is fairly ergonomic for a compact multi tool, but not as good as standard tools. It is pretty heavy, so I wouldn’t carry it in a pocket. Mine fell apart in my saddle bag and a bunch of tools and washers went flying when I pulled it out. I wanted to love this tool, but it isn’t reliable if it falls apart when it isn’t even in use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Overall,  a great little road tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and useful tool, especially with the integrated chain tool, something I never thought I'd need on the road but recently learned I do. As with all multi tools, some things I don't need, e.g. the Torx driver, and probably will never need, e.g. four sizes of spoke wrenches. Would have preferred a small pen knife over the Torx driver, or a larger standard screwdriver. And the case! No use for it, even if it could be opened easily! Two hands and a punch tool needed! It will make a great indestructible, unopenable container for something valuable, but not this great tool.
customer_reviews.author: n Cudesrastomer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow is my 1st reaction to this little tool kit. It comes in an aluminum machined case that is very impressive to look at and feel. Although may not be water proof, it will protect your other gear from being torn up by the tools. Very impressive. The tools are also well made it seems. They fit nice and move on the axis nice. I would buy this again and this would make an excellent gift! You can't go wrong. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes, but they were dashed after 2 rides... all broken.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and after two rides the one in my sons seat pack wasn't usable. We needed it to use it on the trail and the tool was completely jammed or stuck inside the aluminum case. Once we got home we were able to force it out of the case and then it just totally fell apart into all the individual pieces. See image. Hopefully my other one lasts longer, but we'll see. Pretty disappointed thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: keeps falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The multitool options are great, but the screws at the end need to be more solidly attached. It fell apart on me twice, once when I needed it, and the pieces exploded all over the ground when I needed to tighten a piece on my bike. I managed to collect them all and reassemble it, but in order for me to feel comfortable with it not happening again, it's so tight the individual pieces do not come out easily. Easily could be a 5 star tool if they solve the problem with it falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Good idea and range of tools. End screws do not engage fully and come out on a regular basis. I broke one of the tool heads on the first use with very little pressure. I would not buy this item again if you actually need a reliable tool in the backcountry on MTB or bikepacking trips. Around town it may be OK, but anywhere one needs an essential tool for safe travel, I would find something else. I am really surprised at the poor quality given the awesome products Crank Brothers produces otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tool has everything!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this multi-tool for the chain breaker, (because a friend broke his chain at the farthest point from the truck). It was a lesson, because I'm still learning what I need to carry on my bike rides. This multi-tool has just about every tool that you will probably need on the trail to make quick repairs and get you back on the trail. Besides the chain tool, it also has a wide selection on "Allen wrenches" and screw drivers, etc. It's a great add-on to your carry along "kit".
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M.

customer_reviews.title: All around good multitool, everything you need for quick repairs.
customer_reviews.text: Has everything for small adjustments and on-the-go fixes. After a few uses the only problem I had was when I was adjusting my seat, the tool seemed loose, not good for torquing action. I'd suggest tightening the hinges on the tool only a little bit if the hex wrenches flip out easily. I haven't used the chainbreaker yet, but it seems like it would work no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: You'll Need More Tools to Get This One Out
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little multitool. BUT-- if you put it in the metal case that comes with it you will need some other tool to extract it in order to use it. So you need pliers or robust tire levers or something. Got the tool today, will work on coming up with an extraction method some other day. Sheesh. **UPDATE: after slicing my hand on the case-- which has razor sharp edges-- I was able to extract THIS multitool from its case by beating it on the floor to jar it loose and then prying it out with... you guessed it... another multitool.
customer_reviews.author: whepton3

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a Park Tool set of Allen wrenches but needed a Philips head screwdriver so I bought this as a replacement. The first thing I noticed was how heavy this tool set is. At least twice the weight of the Park tool. Sure it has more options but I'm thinking that the shortness of all the tools may limit their usefulness. I guess I will find out as time goes on. So not really sure if this was a good buy. It is what it looks like in the pictures but if you are concerned with weight think twice.
customer_reviews.author: The Devil's Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Fancy Smancy!
customer_reviews.text: As a bicycle road rider that does around 5,000 miles a year, I needed this tool for nearly every little thing that can or would go wrong. I think it's an awesome addition to my stuff except that it is heavy. No! I haven't weighed it. It just feels heavy. But hey, that's good right? It's really built well and I'm sure it will take a lot of abuse. But wait. There's more! It comes in a metal case. Yes! It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Tool fell apart before first use
customer_reviews.text: The tool literally fell apart the second time I held it in my hand. I bought it and put it in my saddle bag. After about two weeks, I took it out to adjust something while out on a trail, and the little bolts that hold the tool together had come completely apart (see photo). I had to pick up bits of tool from all over the trail. Strange that this could pass any kind of quality control. Pretty disappointed customer.
customer_reviews.author: Seth T Bromley

customer_reviews.title: average tool
customer_reviews.text: Let's start with its case. Why would anyone put a bike tool inside that metallic box? It is difficult to open, especially when you are in emergency repair mode. It is hard to carry since you cannot affix it to your bike or to your belt. The tools are in average quality. They will work in an emergency situation in the absence of other tools, but don't count on for longer life.
customer_reviews.author: BostonEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Multitool, Chain Tool isn’t the Best
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool, I really like it. It has everything you need to fix a problem and get back on the trail. The only thing I dislike on this is the chain tool, I busted my chain on the trail and needed to remove a link and it wasn’t working. It could’ve been the fact that the link was shredded, but when I got home and removed it with my Park Tool chain tool it was no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great bike tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I have the smaller Bare Bones bike tool, and wanted one with a few more tool options This is a well designed and made bike tool that comes with it's own sturdy case. You can throw it in your under seat pack for longer road or trail rides. A great value for anyone who wants to be able to make a quick adjustment to a bike component away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy multi-tool, I've used in multiple times in the month that I've had it and had no issues. The only thing I did have a small problem with was getting the cap off of the case that it comes with. Since it had to use a tool to get the cap off I decided not to keep the tool in the case, also because it is a VERY snug fit to get it back in the case.

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool but spoke wrench may not fit fat bike wheels
customer_reviews.text: PROS- Well constructed tool with basic bits. CONS- Hefty weight, there are lighter multi-tools available with these bits. Spoke tool has a groove that the rounded part of spoke is supposed to rest in but was a touch too narrow for spokes on my 26" x 4" wheels making the spoke tool useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: 80% of the tools you need for a bike
customer_reviews.text: This tool is exceptionally well made, and priced very fairly. I tested this tool out the day I received it to install some upgrades and do some adjustments on the bike. The best part was only having to take one tool with me to the shed. It comes with pretty much all the tools you could ask for. Even better, it comes with a lightweight brushed aluminum tool case which is quite handy. Definitely going in my saddlebag.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: For the price paid I do not feel the product offered enough in look, feel, durability, and function as I had hoped. Don't get me wrong, nice product but ultimately this should be sitting in the $12 to $15 range as the same thing could be had cheaper. If you want a $25 -$30 product you need work on the crisp and solid feel of moving the tools in and out of the product. Things should work smoothly and fit nicely and work independently of one another with minimal effort and have a strong durable feel and finish. The function is more or less of a cheap Allen wrench set with a shiny and good looking paint job.
customer_reviews.author: Kujo

customer_reviews.title: Quality and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: They work excellent and the reason I bought them was for convenience of size and versatility and I read a lot of good reviews from different mountain bikers, well known ones, that gave them an excellent review and that’s all they use. I am getting back into mountain biking and I needed a room that was small and compact bit at the same time had all the tools I needed in one place. I can pretty much completely tear my bike apart with this one multi tool. It saves me having to carry around a big toolbox, I can carry this in a pouch under my seat and have it when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdaddymoose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for our bikes. It’s durable and sturdy and looks like it will last a long time. Only negative is the case that comes with it is very difficult to close up when putting the tool back. Not a big deal. We just might toss the case as the tool is in the seat bag. The tool itself is a must have for any type of bike adjustments whether on a ride or for tinkering with it at home.
customer_reviews.author: NVLance

customer_reviews.title: Great tool; crappy case.
customer_reviews.text: The case it comes with literally is too small to hold the tool. You cannot close to top lid. Even when the case is empty, you cant open it up easily at all, because there are no tabs to grip when pulling it off! You need a tool to open up the case for the tool! Otherwise, the tool itself seems fine. The case is a joke though. Crank brothers seriously needs to redesign that.
customer_reviews.author: eklhadjt

customer_reviews.title: does not appear to be very sturdy/durable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the M19 multitool and received it recently. I noticed that there was some damage to the tool (looks to be cosmetic as it's not on the business-end of the tool. However, this also raises concerns about the durability of the tool as that is a single piece of metal. Amazon sent me a replacement and it has the same issues. Pictures included are from the original order as well as the replacement order.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Nice portal bike tool
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it but initial inspection of the tool I think it will be very handy and will be with the bike at all time for this just in case I need it time. would rather have it and not need it then need it and not have it. Also has feature like the spoke key that I wouldn't have thought to get as a separate tool. the added case is a nice touch. very nice it doesn't rattle around in the case too.
customer_reviews.author: macgyver46

customer_reviews.title: Handy Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction. The 19er is perhaps the "sweet spot" of being comprehensive without going overboard. You absolutely need a chain-tool as chain-snaps come second only to flats among common mechanicals. If you are willing to accept the weight of this little power-house, it's as good as they get. The stems of the Allen keys are short but that goes naturally hand in hand with the size of the overall tool-set. It's also a plus that this comes in a smooth sheath of sorts. That way, if it shares space in your saddle pouch with your spare tubes, it won't puncture them by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toolkit who saved me twice last week end
customer_reviews.text: Excellent toolkit who saved me twice last week end.. The first when all my rear wheel spokes went loose after some heavy beating.. I could have broken my wheel easily and discovered that the toolkit has 4 indents to screw spokes. Nice!! Then, in the same day, My right crank started getting loose. The set of tools available where I was didn't have a hallen ranch of the right size but this one had. Lucky or just very well thought out? Doesn't matter.. I won't leave without it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Antony Passemard

customer_reviews.title: No one wants pink, get it at a discount and no one will steal it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this tool for about a month, and my friend has had one for about a year now and I must say that it is one of the most hq tools that I have ever bought for biking, it has most every tool that you will need (bit wise) and the chain breaker works great. And as an added bonus you can get pink and no one will want to steal it. (You can also say it’s for breast cancer or something because let’s be honest, everyone likes those)
customer_reviews.author: Jack of all trades

customer_reviews.title: Screws/ bolts come loose quickly
customer_reviews.text: Literally have to tighten sides with my fingers every time I am on the road and need to use it . It will not stay together. The side bolts are always loose or falling out. Almost lost half the tools on numerous occasions. I have tried tightening it every way I know how even with locktite . It won’t stay together as I assume it should. Other than that it’s a great tool but wish the keys were longer to get better torque
customer_reviews.author: Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Things started out well then....
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good tool until it isn’t- after about a week in my bike bag it completely came apart- see photo- They include a metal case for the tool as it’s obviously a common problem- the only problem with the case is that it takes a crow bar to get the tool out- that’s why I left the tool out of the case- and that’s why I was left digging the pieces out of my bike bag- I guess if you have a tool to get the tool out of its case it will work- just one more thing to carry though and I don't need that- it’s going back unfortunately-
customer_reviews.author: Rawk73

customer_reviews.title: Best bike tool out! Spend the money on this you'll have it all
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy a cheap bike tool like this for $7-$12 but after watching sethsbikehacks on YouTube talk about this tool I spent the extra money and I can say its well worth it due to the strength,case and tools it has on it. The cheap plastic ones fall apart when having to use it hard 1 time and this is bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: RA Deleon

customer_reviews.title: Nicely machined, gold coating comes off
customer_reviews.text: The tools look really sharp.... you know what I mean... and very sleek. They are well made and look sturdy and lightweight. The gold coating on the sides has issues and comes off, and the metal sides are softer metal and dings easily. The case is cool looking, though hard to open. I will probably put bike chain links, patches, etc for my repair kit in there.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: -1 for hard to open case
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight set of emergency road tools for your bike. Case is very hard to open and close. In fact, the first 3 times I opened it, I cut my thumb or finger EVERY TIME. Probably safer to just put it in a ziplock sandwich bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R

customer_reviews.title: 100% Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this multitool when my other tool broke mid-ride. It was extremely frustrating experience because I had only used that tool twice. This one, on the other hand, is in a different class of quality. When I took it out of the box, I immediately noticed how much heavier it was than my old one. The built quality is solid and the tools included have been everything I've needed for working on my bike mid-commute. I can't recommend this tool enough.
customer_reviews.author: David Blakeman

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.  But rusted easily, perhaps.
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool. It's well-built and has everything you need. That said, I had left it in my seat bag during the 3 days of a wet and muddy race, and it the pack got wet and muddy during the race and I think the sag support guys were hosing the bike off afterwards, and despite being brand new it's already rusting. I don't fault the tool entirely for this, but I guess I was surprised at how easily it started rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Vanya

customer_reviews.title: everything you need and more
customer_reviews.text: ended up getting the m19 for the chain breaker even though i knew it would be a beast. i''m a woman with smaller hands and its a bit unwieldy but i just trued my own tire with this little badboy so i'm feeling pretty awesome and confident .
customer_reviews.author: mariel

customer_reviews.title: Real sturdy, feels great, but that cover man 😤
customer_reviews.text: Works great and all. But as most people have a problem with, is the damn case for the crank brothers. It's almost impossible to open without tools. Once you do get it open, I recommend sanding down the nubs that hold it in place so it isn't so hard to open the next time around. But besides that it has all your basic needs in a multi tool for biking. Works and feels very sturdy in the hand. ✅
customer_reviews.author: Ni N

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and more.
customer_reviews.text: Can not go wrong with crankbrothers, especially with the price. I've had the cheaper brands in my pack and tool box and since ordering this crankbrothers m19 multi-tool, I've pulled those cheaper tools off my drawer and pack. Buy the tool once and you'll use it multiple times without any problems. It's super worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very functional, compact
customer_reviews.text: The tools work well, hardness of the tools is good, no stripping. Clever how they fitted in some of the tools like the spoke wrench and crescent wrenches (I have not tried yet). Case is heavy and hard to open, I think I will ditch it. Compactness makes a compromise in leverage for tight bolts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Der

customer_reviews.title: torx bit broke off on first use!
customer_reviews.text: The tip on the torx wrench broke off the first time I used it! Now I have to mail the tool to Crank Brothers to get it serviced. Basically I need to pay for them to fix their product. Avoid! EDIT: ----- Crankbros emailed me back after 36 hours and has informed me that they'll be mailing out to me a replacement T10 tool. Great customer service but the tool shouldn't have broke on the first use. 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Lei Gong

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid multi tool. Beginners should just get this multi tool to save a lot of head aches in the future... my only complaint is that this product is heavy. If you ride with a backpack, it’s noticeable. Not heavy enough to mess up a ride, but you feel the extra weight... This tool is made of high quality and I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed great. I threw it in my bike bag. After about two weeks I pulled it out to use it and one of the screws was coming out. I was able to retighten all the screws. On a long ride I could hear it jingling around in my bag and found it completely separated. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Boarman

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a defective piece. Broke apart.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The parts themselves individually are of good material Heavy weight overall Case can be improved Cons: Tool broke on my first attempt when tightening my bike Tool snapped apart at the site where its held together. So I’m practically using it as individual pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoesnow

customer_reviews.title: Often comes loose and pieces spill out
customer_reviews.text: Twice now the retaining screws have come loose and the parts pour out of the container or saddle bag (Container is a bit bulky and hard to open so I had it in the bag with a rubber band around it) Not really thrilled with this thing. Figured this would be a little better than the no name ones but it’s not good. The tools and chainbreaker worked when I needed them so that’s why it’s not totally 1 Star, but this thing is a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: EAG Parts

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for any bike emergencies or tune ups on the go! A must have for mountain bikers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool because of the reviews that it had previous and the versatility that this multi provides PROS Compact Includes all tools to complete a chain replacement Tighten down any Allen screws needed in the bike Includes a aluminum box to house the multi-tool
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tool, gives leverage, well-built
customer_reviews.text: This tool is exactly what we were looking for. The case is better than expected. Very well-built and gives leverage when using the tools. Got the gold because of cost and the color doesn’t bother me, I love this thing has the most offering of tools which is why I got this one plus has a chain tool. Fits right into my hydration pack. Great multi tool.
customer_reviews.author: Penny.miniaussie

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like this but the torx bit failed
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this along with an array of other tools to build a mountainbike. When I got to bleeding the brakes I used this to remove the torx set screw. Admittedly it was a bit tighter than I expected but still under moderate torque of just one hand. The bit sheared off right in the set screw, so now not only is the tool broken but it totally ruined my brake job and I have no convenient way to finish my brakes. Completely unimpressed with the material properties of this tool
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Garn

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it claims
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend, who really loves working on bicycles. This was something he was iffy about to begin with, but figured he could try it out anyway. Now, he carries it with him in his seat-post bag when he goes mountain biking. It has come in handy on more than a few occasions, and he also uses it regularly when he's changing out parts for his bike. Overall, this product is definitely worth the price if you work on bikes frequently, or just want something small but functional to take with you on biking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Good product, comes with a ridiculous hard case to ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, comes with a ridiculous hard case to store it in, which you just about need tools to it open. Very high priced for what you get, plus their shipping is pathetic, took 2 weeks to get it in which time a bought a Park Tool deluxe set, cheaper better set and comes with a nylon pouch that can be attached to your bike, unlike the hard case that can't be attached to anything! Be sure to read their return policy of 10% restocking + shipping both ways on returned goods.
customer_reviews.author: MStewart

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. So easy
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. It's my go to bike tool. It fits in most places on the bike. If half way through doing something I need a different tool it's right there, I don't have to go looking for a screwdriver. Great on the trail, small pretty light, compact. It's been a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: David Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my chain on the first ride with this tool. Effortlessly and efficiently removed the broken link and repaired the chain and was on my way. Very nice build quality and has a good variety of tools. I'd like to see a tire removal tool integrated into this, but still 5 stars in my book. It is heavy, but it's good quality.
customer_reviews.author: baseballa51

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: Product itself is well-made, but the design (functionality) is horrible. Keys are so loosely mounted in the handle, that they twist and swing and move in all undesired directions while I try to use them on my MTB. If there is a need for speed, or if the weather is cold, I go crazy trying to make use of this thing. I promptly replaced this item with single tools and my sanity returned.
customer_reviews.author: Firestarter

customer_reviews.title: Highly versatile tool. Disappointed that it started to rust within months of sitting in my backpack
customer_reviews.text: Highly versatile tool. Not super light but as expected from a steel tool. I was disappointed to find out that it is not stainless steel as it started to rust within months of sitting in my backpack. Moisture coming from perspiration has caused the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Mike V

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: Works great has all the features I need and then some. Only once so far did one end come loose and the nut fell off that keeps tools in place so make sure the nuts are tight B4 your tool comes apart. Not to tight or you won't be able to use the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The tools are held together by screws that unscrew from vibrations alone. So there I am in the middle of nowhere in the middle of the night needing a tool, pulled this multi-tool for the second time ever, it disassembled and half the tools disappeared in the sand. The next day I tightened the frame screws but they came loose again after another ride. This multi-tool is EXTREMELY unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a must have for any biker. You can probably tear down your entire bike with just this tool. Beautifully designed and made. I've had no issues using this so far. It's portable and gives you all the sizes you'll need for a repair on the trail or a quick adjustment. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Goff

customer_reviews.title: DIFFICULT TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to use. I don't know why this tool has high reviews. I would NOT recommend it. The tools are very hard to maneuver into place for usage. It is certainly compact, but not that light. The main issue is the difficulty in using the tools.
customer_reviews.author: J Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy hinge bolts and low quality steel
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use this and only kept it in the back pocket of my bike for the last year. Last week I had chance to use it the first time, for the screw driver tool. The whole thing start to flex after a few turn then everything falls apart loose and flew everywhere, couldn't even find the hinge bolt to reassemble it. A few tool piece hit the concrete and immediately dented, meaning they are made of soft steel. I don't know if it is just a bad copy but what a shame, the thing is compact and please to the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Dung Vu

customer_reviews.title: A must have in your emergency pack
customer_reviews.text: Unless you like hauling around a tool box....Scratch that, this is a tool box. Practically everything you may need to get you back home if you get stuck in a situation, other than a spare tube and pump. Sure you can use this to just work on your bicycle but this will be your saving grace if you ever get stranded on a ride. It's worth every penny and Crank Bros. make superb quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Piorier

customer_reviews.title: A little clumsy
customer_reviews.text: That's what you'll get with so many features of course. My bike really doesn't need most of what's on here. Especially on a trail. Good to have 'just in case' of course though. Compact enough and gets the job done. Seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Madison, WI

customer_reviews.title: The woods don't have eyes or tools but you do!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't think this is worth owning well then you have never encountered an unwanted trouble in the woods with no easy access to fixxing your problem out there. Awesome tool saved me and a buddies ride today. Lightweight and very simple to use there is nothing to hate about it. Comes with a cool case for the tool as well to keep it protected. Don't be that tool that doesn't have this tool! 🛠👍
customer_reviews.author: Alex P

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multi tool, suggest getting the case.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect multi-tool and the case gives it the perfect form-fit protection it needs from the elements and other things in your saddle/frame bag! I highly recommend Crankbrothers (or Park Tool) over anything else you'll find on Amazon. Just spend the smidge extra and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I have read the negative reviews and maybe those people but from a different seller or just had defaulted product. Our tool is perfect, its strong doesnt bend where it shouldn't. Weve used it alot since we bought it. My husband loves the case. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Nice multi-tool. Lost a voulpe stars because it dosent have the right size hex for my lock on grips and the chain tool is constantly flopping around getting in the way while using any of the tools. Also chain tool, although it works, can only remove the pin where others I've seen are cut differently so (in theory) you can press it in, and more importantly fix a binding chain.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: After over 10 years with my old tool the chain part didn't work on my 1x12 set up so I got this. It's nice and compact with a good tool selection. It's sturdy and works well. I have only 1 complaint. The case is extremely hard to open when it is new. After looking at the closure I am nervous it may become loose after repeated use. But so far so good
customer_reviews.author: DTMFM

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly good bike multi-tool. I carry this with me whether I am road or mountain biking. It folds up flat and is very compact considering the number of tools contained within. I have helped friends make adjustments to seats, derailleur limits, and even tightened up a loose fork on the trail. What constitutes an easy job with the right tool becomes an impossibility without. A good multi-tool is essential on my rides and this does everything it should.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Essential Tool For All Rides
customer_reviews.text: The tool arrived intact and in retail packaging. The tool bits are perfectly machined. Also, the tool comes with a metal (thin but sturdy) tool case so the tool bits do not scratch/rip your backpack. The tool weighs 175 grams and with a metal tool case the total weight is 240 grams. Yes, I actually weighed the tool and case. This is a high quality Crankbrothers product.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Suited for shop, not a bike bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty tool. I can't vouch for the quality yet, as I haven't torqued down on anything, but it's not exactly small and it's quite heavy. It's more suited for the shop than it is for carrying on the bike. The case is cumbersome
customer_reviews.author: D. Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I'm a guide who does alot of mountain biking with clients and have put it to the test many times! It's held up great and has most of what is needed in one tool! Carry tube is solid and streamlines everything nicely! This thing is built like a tank so no worries of breaking it, but if I ever lose it, I will not purchase anything other than this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi tool
customer_reviews.text: Needed a multi tool to carry in a hydration pack while biking. This has more features than I have needed so far and while not as convenient for at home use due to the size and ergonomics has still served me well changing pedals and adding water bottle cages, etc. Also like the protective case.
customer_reviews.author: Josepí

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made with substantial feel. Combined this with a multi-tool with pliers and cutting blades and have a very versatile tool kit. The hex wrenches fit precisely so that I don't fear rounding heads if I apply a little too much torque.
customer_reviews.author: carterjm

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: Works good. It's small and easily fits in a bike bag with other items. Seems to have everything I might need on the road. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Have gotten more use out of this over any of my other tools
customer_reviews.text: End up cracking this out every day now that my seatpost has failed on me and having to make adjustments constantly while riding or at the house. Saved me multiple times at this point, would buy this many times over now.
customer_reviews.author: Rikk Caro

customer_reviews.title: Do it all tool but weak Allen wrench
customer_reviews.text: The tool was a do it all trail tool including a chain breaker. It is heavy but any tool with this many options will be. My rating reflects that the first time I used the 6mm Allen to loosen and tetighten my suspension pivots to fix a creak the Allen wrench twisted when torquing to a standard torque. I returned the tool and am now on the selection path again.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonWI

customer_reviews.title: Came with light scratches, but still nice looking I guess.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars, but it came with some minor scratches and it's so hard to remove from it's packaging. I literally had to stare at it for a few mins. Perhaps you should try not tying the the zip ties too tight?? Most annoyed with the tiny scratches, but it will serve its purpose..
customer_reviews.author: manonthelurk

customer_reviews.title: best bike multitool I could find
customer_reviews.text: I got this and the Topeak Alien II Multi Tool around the same time to find a tool to accompany my leatherman wave and spare tube/portable pump for biking emergencies. Where the Alien II is flimsy/wobbly and has tons of play, the crank brothers tool is as solid as the leatherman. While the Alien II has more functions, its seriously crippled by the lame plastic frame/clasp and bulky size. Needless to say, the Crank Brothers tool stays in my bike pack, while the Alien II stays home. -This tool rocks!
customer_reviews.author: yup pete

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Multi-Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool has bailed me out several times on the trail, and also been useful for needed repairs at home in my garage. The chain breaker tool works perfectly, which is why I upgraded to this one. Fits perfectly in my zipper pocket in my Fox Ranger cargo shorts. I never leave on a ride without it!
customer_reviews.author: Jakis Maximus

customer_reviews.title: CRANKBROTHERS multi tools work.  Get the 19 version....
customer_reviews.text: This multi tool is the bomb for my wedge under seat bike emergency repair. A lot of these kinds of tools have no phillips. This Crankbrothers version has everything to get you home while out on the trail. I have had to break a chain, remove links, put it on one sprocket due to a dead derailleur..... you want one of these for your pack.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Nail

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Every single time I use it I have to tighten the Allen head bolts that keep loosening and many have experienced the tool completely falling apart from the bolts coming completely loose. also, the chain break tool is ALWAYS in the way, not worth the money and be looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I was no sure if I would get what the pic shows, but, yes. the item is as is described, it is as you see the picture on the web page. I am glad I have it, very versatile, I am happy camper, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: It is compact and perfect size to bring/keep it for emergency fixing. The design is beautiful. Only problem is that the case which comes with the multi-tool is too hard to open/close. I wish it was easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Missing 5mm hex
customer_reviews.text: Tool unfortunately has two 6mm hex wrenches. Leaving me without a 5mm, which is what I needed on my last ride. Didn’t notice until after I tried to use it. Case fits extremely tight and is difficult to get the tool out when in it so I’ve chosen not to use it. Otherwise, handy but would love to get a replacement with the correct sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Haylett

customer_reviews.title: Hex wrenches are a little bit too short.
customer_reviews.text: Tool seems solid enough. But the hex wrenches are a bit on the short side compared to previous similar tools that I've owned. This seriously complicated an emergency brake caliper adjustment that I needed to make after a crash. Not enough space to rotate the tool without hitting stays or rotor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Kraftcheck

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Very soft edges. I’ve almost stripped more than one bolt as the Allen keys round out on this. Also they are a bit short and I can’t reach my Sram derailleur limit screws with it. I’ll probably give it away and buy the park multi tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but rusted after being left in a backpack in the garage when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: Tools has everything that you need. Started to rust within weeks of ownership though. I keep it in my bag in the garage and end up using it every other week or so for small things along the trail. I live in CA nearby the water so salty air is an issue, but I did expect it to hold up a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it use it even off the trail
customer_reviews.text: I carry it my back pocket and don’t know it’s there and my shorts aren’t tight tight fitting And for must of the things I do on my bike I just grab this because it’s always handy I carry it my water bottle that I take everywhere I go that way I don’t forget my M19 when I go hit the trail And the case is nice also I’ve landed on it couple time and has not hurt me and has not dented either.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wigant

product_meta.title: Crankbrothers M19 Multi-Tool + Case
product_meta.description: With more options, the M19 works for all types of riders. An increased number of tools means you'll never be wondering if it can handle your bike.
feature_bullets: Includes Two Phillips and Two Flathead Screwdrivers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
